intro: Sweetiopsis hassleri, commonly known as the mountain sweetiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
